[[Image:Selhorys.png|thumb|right|200px|A map showing the location of Selhorys on the continent of Westeros.]]
'''Selhorys''' is a town in western [[Essos]], located on the eastern bank of the [[Rhoyne]]. The town is located north of [[Volantis]] and [[Valysar]].<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/locations/volantis/ HBO viewers guide, season 2 map, Volantis entry]</ref>
sections.In the books: In the ''[[Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels Selhorys is a settlement under the rule of [[Volantis]]. It is located at the confluence of the Rhoyne and the Selhoru. It pays tribute to passing [[Dothraki]] ''[[khalasar]]s'', which can easily reach the city from the western-most edge of the [[Dothraki sea]], which is located not far to the east of the settlement. By the standards of the [[Free Cities]], Selhorys is a middling-sized town, although by the standards of [[Westeros]] it would be a small city.
